brief_summary.textblock:
To identify the Maximum Tolerated Dose levels of LEO 43204 after once daily treatment for
      two consecutive days and to evaluate efficacy of LEO 43204 in two doses after once daily
      treatment for two consecutive days compared to vehicle

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Doses of LEO 43204 Once Daily for Two Consecutive Days on Full Balding Scalp in Subjects With Actinic Keratosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Part 1: Subjects with 5 to 20 clinically typical, visible and discrete AKs on the
             full balding scalp.

          -  Part 2: Subjects with 5 to 20 clinically typical, visible and discrete AKs on the
             full balding scalp

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Location of the treatment area

               -  within 5 cm of an incompletely healed wound

               -  within 5 cm of a suspected basal cell carcinoma (BCC) or squamous cell carcinoma
                  (SCC)

          -  Prior treatment with ingenol mebutate gel on the treatment area

          -  Lesions in the treatment areas that have

               -  atypical clinical appearance (e.g., hypertrophic, hyperkeratotic or cutaneous
                  horns) and/or

               -  recalcitrant disease (e.g., did not respond to cryotherapy on two previous
                  occasions)

clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of Escalating Doses of LEO 43204 Applied Once Daily for Two Consecutive Days on Full Balding Scalp in Subjects With Actinic Keratosis

authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration
Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices

primary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Dose Limiting Toxicity up to and including Day 8

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Partial clearance of AKs at Week 8, defined as at least 75% reduction from baseline in the number of clinically visible AKs

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
